info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 11:41AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Cabarrus, eastern Catawba, Davie, eastern Alexander, eastern Lincoln, Iredell, Mecklenburg, Rowan, Gaston and Union Counties through 1230 PM EDT... At 1141 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles south of Ronda to near Rock Hill. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gastonia, Uptown Charlotte, Huntersville, Kannapolis, Downtown Concord, Monroe, Salisbury, Statesville, Mocksville and Lincolnton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
